title: Senior Software Engineer (SF or NYC, $140-160K)
description:
Nylas is a product built for engineers, by engineers. We make it easy to add email, contacts, and calendars to any app. By being at the core of business communication, we believe we can shape the future of how people work.

We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help us scale and build new products on top of our APIs. Right now, our open-source Python sync engine regularly archives terabytes of data across a massive SQL cluster, and our Flask APIs handle tens of millions of requests a day.

We make a big effort to create an inclusive environment that is open, frank, and empowering. If you’re excited to architect complex systems with a small, rapidly-growing team, come join us!

About Nylas

Nylas makes it easy to add email, contacts, and calendars to any app. We have spent the last four years developing an API that is clean, performant, secure, and saves our customers an average of 18 months of development time. Since a user’s inbox has more data than your typical startup, we’ve had to solve some pretty challenging big data, high speed, and availability requirements.

Nylas has raised over $8M from 8VC, Data Collective, Fuel Capital, SV Angel and more. Our team is based in San Francisco and members have previously worked at Dropbox, Google, Facebook, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, and VMware.

Our team collaboratively wrote about our values, benefits, perks, and published them in our open-source handbook. Learn more them here: https://www.keyvalues.com/nylas.

About This Job

In this job you will:

  • Own and ship new features from inception to deployment in a highly-collaborative environment
  • Mentor fellow engineers and help set engineering norms and best practices
  • Work on projects like sharding and scaling existing systems, implementing new Exchange protocols, or architecting mail data processing pipelines
  • Work to improve the day to day workflow, developer experience, and velocity of your team
  • Be an investigator for tricky, critical customer issues
  • If you’re up for it, you can even talk at conferences, write blog posts, and make strong showings at local events!

What makes you a great fit for this role:

  • You love working collaboratively with your fellow engineers on a daily basis
  • You’re pragmatic as an engineer and empathize deeply with the customers using your product
  • You have experience architecting or helping build a product’s architecture at scale, including large infrastructural and data challenges - especially across multiple servers
  • You love finding ways to make your whole team’s life better and would love to have a hand in shaping your team’s growth and culture
  • You love using Python OR are excited by the prospect of using Python on a daily basis. You’re also excited about using different parts of our tech stack:
    • Backend: Python with MyPy, Flask, SQL, Redis, AWS, nginx, ElasticSearch, Linux
    • Frontend: Flow-typed Javascript, React/Redux
    • DevOps: Ansible, AWS

Benefits:

  • Salary is between $140,000 and $160,000
  • We have offices in both San Francisco and New York City with an occasional work-from-home policy
  • We offer full medical/vision/dental insurance, including families
  • Generous vacation (including mandatory 10-consecutive-biz-day vacation every year)
  • 401k plan
  • Commuter benefits in SF + $100 monthly Lyft credit
  • Lunch provided every day!
  • Gym membership reimbursement up to $70/month
  • Book clubs (books purchased for these are free)
  • Massages every other Wednesday (by appt)
  • $1000 annual allowance for continuing education like classes and conferences
how_to_apply: Email your resume to mj@teamtheory.co or apply directly at https://nylas.workable.com/jobs/687602.

title: Java Systems Engineer
description:
YinzCam is the industry-leading mobile developer for sports team apps in the United States, with clients in most major professional sports leagues including the NFL, NBA, NHL, MLS, and even international clients such as the Australian National Rugby League. We are experiencing a period of significant growth in our business, and are looking to add more full-time employees to build upon critical applications used by our clients and users, and to enhance the systems our mobile apps depend upon.

You will have the opportunity to work in a team of highly-skilled and experienced developers to build and deploy the tools that support professional sports teams’ official mobile apps, and that will improve the experience of millions of fans around the world. You will work closely with designers and back-end developers in a collaborative environment to develop compelling applications and client-facing interfaces. You will also have the opportunity to innovate and explore cutting edge technologies and frameworks.

WHY ARE WE HIRING? We are currently expanding rapidly to take on even more clients – more teams, stadiums, and sports, including overseas – and we are looking to grow our mobile team by adding full-time developers to meet the demand for our products, and to bring even more innovations and features to our existing offerings. Our company affords a close-knit entrepreneurial environment with every individual being exposed to, and having a tangible impact on, the company’s business.

Desired Skills and Experience Required:

  • At least 2 years of experience in programming with Java SE
  • Experience with Java 7 language features, familiarity with Java 8
  • Experience with network programming and web services (Jersey or JAX-RS is desirable) - -
  • Experience with dependency injection techniques desired (e.g., Google Guice)
  • Experience with XML and JSON serialization (JAXB is desirable)
  • Experience with database interfaces (jOOQ is desirable)
  • Familiarity with common third-party Java utility libraries (Apache Commons, Google Guava, Joda Time)
  • Experience using Maven for build management and automation (Gradle experience also acceptable) - Experience with Git for version control

Highly desirable:

  • Experience with C# and ASP.NET MVC -
  • Experience with one or more scripting languages (Python and Bash preferred)
  • Experience interfacing with mobile and/or web developers and designing client-server interfaces
  • Experience with Linux programming and system administration
  • Experience with MySQL database administration
  • Experience with Amazon Web Services or Microsoft Azure
  • Experience with common web servers such as IIS and Nginx
  • Have at least one back-end project that you developed (or contributed substantially to)

Please send your resume and highlight:

  • Your overall technical skills and background
  • Your relevant professional and academic experience
  • Your Java development skills (mention example projects, number of months of experience)
  • Your back-end development skills (mention example projects, number of months of experience)
  • Your system-integration skills, e.g., working with software libraries, APIs
  • Your software-engineering skills, e.g., version control (mention how many others on the team, and what your role was on the project)

To all recruitment agencies: YinzCam does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias.  YinzCam is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
imgix is looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer to join our Infrastructure Engineering team. In this role, you will work closely with other members of the Infrastructure team to build and operate the high performance, high availability infrastructure that powers image delivery for some of the largest sites on the Internet.

The imgix Infrastructure team is responsible not just for building and operating the core imgix service, but also for encouraging operational best practices in the larger engineering organization. We seek experienced engineers who not only have strong professional skill sets but who are also passionate about making positive contributions to the evolution of their team members and the company as a whole.

Core Team Responsibilities

  • Build and operate highly reliable and performant systems at scale.
  • Observe and measure the imgix infrastructure for performance, reliability and correctness.
  • Contribute expertise towards architectural planning and ensure that the company builds services that meet our objectives, are operationally maintainable, and leverage the right tools and frameworks.
  • Foster and promote operational awareness within the engineering team.
  • Actively participate in the review and testing process for our production services.

You Are

  • Pragmatic about your engineering choices; able to change course when new information becomes available; focused on problem solving.
  • A believer in automation as a tool that helps to reduce operational incidents and improves reliability.
  • Collaborative in a team environment when designing and implementing systems; excited to transfer knowledge and expertise to others.
  • Passionate about improving service quality.

Things You've Done Before

  • Participated in on-call rotations for a large scale production infrastructure.
  • Automated a zero-downtime deployment in a high traffic environment.
  • Worked in an environment that utilized Content Delivery Networks.
  • Utilized configuration management tools (such as Chef, Ansible or Puppet).
  • Administered Linux production systems, with some familiarity around software packaging and system tuning.
  • Monitored and collected data from production systems (using tools like Grafana, Prometheus, Nagios, Logstash).

About Us

imgix is building the future of visual media on the Internet. The imgix service is the premier solution to deliver impactful, engaging, highly responsive and super fast imagery to eyeballs around the world. It consists of a top tier image delivery platform tightly coupled with imgix's proprietary, on-demand image processing pipeline. It also provides customers with great design flexibility while reducing the engineering investment required to serve state-of-the-art visual media. imgix enables our customers to greatly increase the value of their imagery and get back to building awesome things.

We are located in downtown San Francisco, pretty close to BART, Caltrain and a really good sandwich place. Employee benefits are comprehensive (401k, medical, dental and vision), perks are generous (catered lunches, paid rides home, the occasional team outing), vacation time is flexible and salaries are commensurate with experience. We also provide employees with the tools they need to be effective in their work: fancy keyboards, standing desks, a desk cactus and maybe even a laptop.


If you would like to help us build the future of image serving on the Internet, submit your resume/CV for consideration. Principals only please. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Software Engineer - HashiCorp Packer
description:
HashiCorp builds DevOps tools for modern applications. We build open source tools, and enterprise products on top of them. The HashiCorp suite empowers organizations to provision hybrid cloud infrastructure, secure secrets across distributed applications, and run dynamic resources.

We value top-notch collaboration and communication skills, both among internal teams and in how we interact with our users. We take care to balance and be responsive to the needs of our open source community as well as our enterprise level customers.

HashiCorp Engineering is largely a remote team. While prior experience working remotely isn't required, we are looking for team members who perform well given a high level of independence and autonomy.

HashiCorp’s Packer is an open source project that automates the building of machine images across cloud provider and virtualization tools. It is used for business critical operations around the world, at start-ups and Fortune 500 companies. You will need to navigate the complexity of a broad portfolio of users and use cases, while at the same time keeping the project focused by adhering to the Tao of HashiCorp.

We want you to contribute to development and maintenance of Packer in tight collaboration with the growing Packer community, utilizing operations and engineering skills to work across a diverse set of infrastructure providers.

In this role, you can expect to:

  • Support integrations with new and existing infrastructure providers.
  • Help support open source contributors, new and seasoned, with supportive and constructive code review, documentation improvements, and workflow changes.
  • Work on Packer issues and improvements critical to the success of HashiCorp customers and the broader community.

You may be a good fit for our team if:

  • You're comfortable and enjoy writing Go.
  • You have experience with customer support or OSS community support to help work with the Packer community.
  • You understand the challenges of operating and maintaining production systems in cloud environment.
  • You are familiar with infrastructure management concepts and ecosystem.
  • You understand Packer and care about its users' experience.

In your cover letter, please describe why you're interested in working at HashiCorp, and on the Packer team in particular.

At HashiCorp, we are committed to hiring and cultivating a diverse team. We're always looking to fill multiple roles: if you are on the fence about whether you would be successful working with us, please apply anyway!
how_to_apply: Submit your resume and cover letter at https://www.hashicorp.com/jobs/1128730

title: Senior UI Software Engineer, Core Technology Group (Big Data and Cloud)
description:
Job Number: 23303

At Informatica, We “DATA”. We Do Good, Act As One Team, Think Customer First, and Aspire For The Future. Informatica enables companies to unleash the power of data to become more agile, realize new growth opportunities, lead to new inventions resulting in intelligent market disruptions.

A career with Informatica gives you all the opportunities and benefits that can only come from working for the trusted industry leader, including amazing, energetic team members; a globally diverse workplace; and a company dedicated to your success, growth and advancement.

Our Team

The Core Technology Group (CTG) is the innovation hub within Informatica that delivers an extensible and scalable platform that is the foundation for all other Informatica products. Specifically, our team focuses on a high performance Data Engine that can scale on Hadoop, Spark, Cloud and multi-processor environments. The engine can handle batch, request/response and real-time streaming workloads to deliver data for applications. Thousands of customers rely on our service for moving billions of records every day.

Your Opportunity

The Data Engine has been a key constituent of Informatica’s platform and serves multiple products such as Data Services, Data Quality and Profiling. Informatica products rely on the Data Engine to fulfill the vision of a Virtual Data Machine which can execute data integration jobs either natively or across execution environments such as relational databases, Hadoop or cloud.

You will be a key contributor to fulfilling this vision by providing our customers with UI-driven tooling for developing data pipelines to seamlessly run data transformation without specialized coding. This data could be enterprise and partner data from hosted Cloud services and on-premise deployments or arbitrary data from social web sites and media.

Our Ideal Candidate

You are an experienced UI software engineer who has worked on developing large UI systems. You relish the opportunity to work at the intersection of Big Data and usability to deliver data processing capability across different use cases that include batch, request/response and real-time systems.

You enjoy technical challenges, assuming new responsibilities and leveraging your strong communication skills.

Your Responsibilities

The successful candidate will be based in Redwood City, CA and will be responsible for:

  • Working with technical leaders and stakeholders to understand requirements and design user interface mockups and diagrams to help visualize changes in functionality
  • Ensuring product adoption by using your design and usability skills to influence technical product decisions
  • Facilitating the collaboration and engagement between senior members of the team to ensure sound design and implementation of big functional areas for the Data Engine
  • Working closely with architects, development and QA engineers to discuss and evangelize features
  • Collaborating with geographically dispersed, cross-functional teams in an Agile environment
  • Mentoring junior engineers on technical, architectural, design and related issues

Representative accountabilities may include, but are not limited to:

  • Designing, implementing, documenting, analyzing and operationalizing platform features clearly to ensure that others may readily utilize them
  • Interacting with QA and documentation teams to clearly communicate the features and behaviors of the system
  • Reviewing functional and test specifications and conducting training sessions for global services and support teams
  • Assisting customers and field engineers with troubleshooting issues and problems

Your Qualifications

  • 4 or more years of relevant professional experience, a portion of which was within an enterprise software company
  • Solid experience developing UI products
  • Good understanding of UI development patterns such as MVC, Observer/Observable
  • Strong programming skills in Java
  • Demonstrated understanding of object oriented design and programming
  • Knowledge of Hadoop, Hive, and Spark is highly desired
  • Knowledge of Cloud ecosystems (AWS, Azure, etc) is a great plus
  • Experience with Eclipse RCP, OSGI is a great plus
  • Proven ability to work well with others in a fast paced, iterative product definition and development environment
  • Able to work independently with little direct supervision and take initiative; willing to mentor and develop others
  • Working knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle, QA methodology, testing techniques and approaches
  • Experience in the following: test automation, build infrastructure, release tooling, framework development

title: Principal User Experience Designer
description:
Job Number: 23292

At Informatica, We “DATA”. We Do Good, Act As One Team, Think Customer First, and Aspire For The Future. Informatica enables companies to unleash the power of data to become more agile, realize new growth opportunities, lead to new inventions resulting in intelligent market disruptions.

A career with Informatica gives you all the opportunities and benefits that can only come from working for the trusted industry leader, including amazing, energetic team members; a globally diverse workplace; and a company dedicated to your success, growth and advancement.

Principal User Experience (UX) Designer – Informatica Enterprise Data Lake (EDL)

Our Team

The Informatica User Experience (UX) team is the driving force behind the design and usability of a broad spectrum of data integration and data management products. We are a globally diverse, world-class team of designers and researchers who drive the product user experiences and innovation initiatives company-wide. We are a creative, collaborative, and fun team and believe in recruiting the best. We care deeply about each team members work-life balance, and are committed to growing careers.

Your Opportunity

Achieving success in next-generation analytics has been constrained by the difficulty of accessing data in silos, and the traditional approach of gathering requirements, and then designing and building valuable data assets. In the age of data democratization, business analysts and data scientists are looking for self-service methods to discover relevant data and prepare it for actionable insights. To help customers with these challenges, Informatica is creating self-service data-discovery and preparation capabilities for data analysts in big data and the cloud. We are seeking a Principal User Experience Designer who can take the lead on delivering simple, understandable, yet powerful solutions addressing these new challenges.

Our Ideal Candidate

You are highly experienced in user-centered UX design for enterprise applications. You excel in designing rich, scalable, and high-productivity web-based, cloud services. You thrive in a collaborative environment working with other UX designers, researchers and product team members to deliver best practices in user-centered design, information architecture, and interaction design. You enjoy working with product managers to understand and define business requirements, but you are also well-versed in discussing technical capabilities and constraints with software developers. Most importantly you relish interacting with customers, testing your design ideas and assumptions, and validating your designs to help the company manage risks and costs.

Your Responsibilities

The successful candidate will be based at our Redwood City, CA campus and will be responsible for:

  • Planning and designing our Enterprise Data Lake product
  • Delivering UX designs while working closely with cross-functional teams (Product Managers, User Researchers, UX Designers, and Developers) to create innovative user experiences for new and extended product offerings.
  • Helping to plan and conduct stakeholder interviews and design workshops
  • Synthesizing results from user research into coherent designs
  • Creating information architectures, task flows, user interaction models, wireframe screen flows, prototypes, detailed designs, design briefs, design specifications and guidelines with little direction
  • Influencing product teams and the organization to achieve solutions that are right for our customers
  • Fostering a fun, creative, collaborative spirit

Your Qualifications

  • 8+ years of experience designing user interfaces and user experiences for web-based software
  • Masters’ degree or equivalent in related discipline (HCI, Industrial Design, Cognitive Psychology, Graphic Design, etc.)
  • A portfolio that demonstrates your design talent, including conceptual models, navigation and user flows, information design, and high-fidelity mock-ups
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of “design-led” product development
  • Proven ability to generate end-to-end designs - from concept through production detailing
  • Demonstrated experience developing and communicating UX design guidelines and design specifications
  • Proven effectiveness working in cross-functional teams that include product management, engineering, marketing, and other UX professionals
  • Demonstrated proficiency with wireframing/prototyping tools, such as Sketch, Illustrator, Axure, Photoshop, Balsamiq, Visio, etc.
  • Experience using user-research methods, analytics, and other insights to guide product direction
  • Excellent written and verbal skills

### Nice to Have

  • Previous experience designing products that allow users to view, prepare, and analyze data sets.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

description:

Our industry leading Big Data Management technologies--along with our partners--have helped fuel incredible growth over the last five years. We are seeking a Senior Product Manager to grow Informatica’s Big Data products.

Your Opportunity

In this newly-created role, you will help shape the direction of Informatica big data management product portfolio that enables us to further our leadership position in a highly competitive and rapidly changing market. You will:

  • Lead the product management for Big Data on Cloud
  • Set the product roadmap, driving customer adoption, collaborating with Hadoop technology partners & cloud ecosystems like AWS, Azure, Google cloud and ensuring successful deployments for Informatica’s Big Data products.

Our Ideal Candidate

You have prior product management experience and a deep technical background with Big Data, cloud(AWS/Azure), Serverless technologies and/or data integration. You feel comfortable being hands-on with complex technology, have a keen understanding of how it can bring value to a diverse customer base, and can expand adoption across different channels and partner ecosystems. You are a cross-functional leader who will work collaboratively with architecture and product engineering teams, Informatica’s marketing, sales and services staff, and product marketing to drive sales success and results for the Big Data products. You will also work with product managers in other product lines to ensure their products work seamlessly in the Big Data use cases. You enjoy working with customers, partners, sales people, engineers, and anyone else you need in order to achieve business success. You are awesome at creating compelling Try & Buy software offering, and vibrant user community to drive product awareness, adoption, revenue, reference, and success.

Your Responsibilities

Reporting to the Director of Big Data Product Management and based in Redwood City, CA, you will:

  • Work closely with key customers and partners to understand the use cases for Big Data solutions especially on cloud, gaining a deep understanding of their goals and requirements.
  • Clearly communicate the value proposition and differentiation of Informatica’s Big Data offerings to our customers
  • Keep up to date with the rapidly evolving technologies in the Big Data space and understand the relevance and impact to Informatica’s products
  • Author detailed “whole” product requirements including requirements for big data on cloud
  • Serve as the voice of the customer in building product functionality that is fit for purpose
  • Collaborate with other product managers to ensure seamless operation between components and technologies
  • Engage with partners to manage product offerings across hosted and on-premise ecosystems
  • Work closely with R&D to drive product priorities and ensure the right set of functionalities for an enterprise class, industry leading product
  • Identify needs and develop materials for rapid and effective field enablement
  • Provide content for product collaterals, technical white papers and other material needed to ensure fast and successful adoption of the product by customers
  • Perform competitive analysis, market, and industry research
  • Contribute to the development of the overall product strategy, product roadmap, and business plan for the solution
  • Drive user based community and help in enablement for system integrators, internal field and customers.

Your Qualifications

  • 5 or more years in product management or equivalent roles with activity spanning participation in conducting competitive analysis, writing detailed requirement specifications, gathering and prioritizing customer requirements, defining the product roadmap, and authoring technical white papers
  • Experience in enterprise applications, big data and data integration
  • Strong experience on cloud technologies like AWS/Azure/google including cloud based big data offering like EMR, HDInsight.
  • Experience in bringing on-premise enterprise product to cloud to offer as a serverless manage service.
  • Prior experience in driving user based community and customer adoption.
  • Prior experience in driving expansion of an enterprise software product across partner ecosystems and channels, including on-premise and cloud ecosystem.
  • Demonstrated success working with external partner teams
  • Strong project management skills and demonstrated ability to coordinate multiple parties within Informatica and external partners to deliver a product
  • Experience in driving the success of both mature, stable products as well as new and innovative product concepts
  • Ability to gather and prioritize requirements, develop detailed requirements, review functional specifications, participate in functional reviews
  • Working knowledge of products and technologies in the Big Data and Data Integration markets
  • Strong technical background with the ability to quickly develop deep product knowledge and communicate the business values to the field and customers
  • Excellent communication (written and oral) and presentation skills
  • Proven organizational skills; ability to multi-task and work on several assignments concurrently; detail oriented
  • Ability to contribute to defining a strategic vision and to articulate it in front of a variety of audiences
  • Self-motivated and team-oriented; able to work both autonomously and effectively as part of a geographically dispersed team
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, proven track record of building strong relationships and establishing credibility with customers, prospects, analysts, sales, R&D, and the management team
  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering/Computer Science or a related technical discipline
  • Willing to travel (approximately 15%) for customer visits and trade shows, as well as visit Informatica offices worldwide

title: Cloud Product Operations Software Engineer
description:
Job Number23046

At Informatica, We “DATA”. We Do Good, Act As One Team, Think Customer First, and Aspire For The Future. Informatica enables companies to unleash the power of data to become more agile, realize new growth opportunities, lead to new inventions resulting in intelligent market disruptions.

A career with Informatica gives you all the opportunities and benefits that can only come from working for the trusted industry leader, including amazing, energetic team members; a globally diverse workplace; and a company dedicated to your success, growth and advancement.

Our Team

We’re always on the lookout for people with the same qualities as Informatica itself. As recognised leaders in Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Data Management, we have no room for followers. We gained our market leading position through hard work, strong focus, incredible dedication and exceptional performance – the very virtues we are looking for in new Informatica people.

We need people who carve their own niche, quickly understand priorities and know what needs to be done to get things moving. We expect our people to adapt to an informal atmosphere and appreciate the tremendous advantage of being surrounded by dedicated experts.

In return, we offer the unique opportunity to join one of the most visionary, exciting and fastest growing software companies in the world, working with advanced technology and great products that are truly changing and improving the way our customers do business.

Your responsibilities

  • Manage business applications on a brand-new cloud platform based on a microservice architecture.
  • Take over responsibility for CI and deployment.
  • Work in small teams in an agile process (SCRUM).
  • Collaborate with colleagues from other teams across the globe.
  • Proactively improve existing tools and processes.
  • Document outcome of work, be able to present solution to others.

Your qualifications

  • Experience as DevOps engineer or build engineer.

  • Excellent knowledge in UNIX.

Informatica offers a competitive compensation package that includes base salary, medical, retirement programs, flexible time off and more.
